column2: §YPalouse Falls§!\nA massive waterfall carries the Palouse River into the gorge to the Snake. Although the sight is beautiful, more than a few travelers have met their end falling off the sheer cliffs.

The Black Cross are a loosely organized collective of insular communities, travelling bard-preachers, and militant heresiarchs who share a belief in the “Straight-Edged Path” in rebellion against a figure only known as “the Man”, who they believe imprisoned the mother-goddesses Anarkee and Gaia in the Event. The Straight-Edged Path mandates abstination from drugs, alcohol, and premarital sex, a path that they believe will lead to freeing of the Mothers from the Man’s control. Black Crossers bear a particular opposition to the rearing of livestock, and often seek to destroy the practice through force.

La Hermandad, or “The Brotherhood” is the name commonly used to refer to a group of Chicano Christians in the interior Pacific Northwest. Far from the Mexican heartland, the Meseteño have merged Mexican Christianity with a reverence for saints of agriculture and labor, believing that kings should work the fields besides their subjects.

Dominionists are a particularly fundimentalist and militant branch of Protestant Christianity, emerging in the decades before the Event, but solidifying their power in the Inland Northwest in the years after. Dominionists believe that America fell due to its degradation by unbelievers and agents of Communism. They believe that America can only be restored through the strict application of Biblical law and the destruction of all who they deem oppose Christ and America.

The Sovereignists are a religious movement who emerged shortly before the Event, who believe that the day-to-day state of man is a lie, and one’s true self can only be obtained through a combination of ritual ceremonies and incantations known as Asseveration. Upon Asseveration, Sovereignists believe the soul will become Redeemed and become able to tap into a spirit realm known as the Treasury to gain wealth and power.

These are the followers of a lost Guru, a follower of the Guru Christ. The Millenarians believe that the Event was a cleansing of the earth in preparation for Christ’s return, which will occur at the latest in 2239 -- 6000 years after the creation of the earth, by the Jewish tradition, and thus the start of the Seventh Millennium. A Millennial Sabbath.

The Mine Cult is a name assigned to a variety of cults and pseudo-faiths that sprang sometimes independently around the Rocky Mountains. They revere the massive mines left by their forefathers, the heritage of the Rocky Mountain Miner, and the great wealth those mines provide. The Mine Cult dogma is inconsistent, but most Mine Cultists believe that it is their duty to strike the earth as their fathers had, and that one day, upon finding their pantheon's head, The Motherlode, He Who Bust's will shall be made manifest, and he will deplete the last deposits, close their mines, and "lay off" their holy miners.

The Mine Cult is a name assigned to a variety of cults and pseudo-faiths that sprang sometimes independently around the Rocky Mountains. They revere the massive mines left by their forefathers, the heritage of the Rocky Mountain Miner, and the great wealth those mines provide. The Mine Cult dogma is inconsistent, but most Mine Cultists believe that it is their duty to strike the earth as their fathers had, and that one day, upon finding their pantheon's head, The Motherlode, He Who Bust's will shall be made manifest, and he will deplete the last deposits, close their mines, and "lay off" their holy miners. The codes and traditions of the Mine Cultists have been codified into a book entitled "The Operator's Manual".

In the Wild Wilderness of California, lay the men and women of the Rangers of Muir, a dedicated force of individuals who continue to recite the ancient creed of "Conservation", to this they maintain ranger camps across the California watching for the siren calls of the Dark Cicada which will herald the fires that are believed to have consumed the old world.  As stated from one of their patron deities the Guardian of the Woods, Smokey "Only you can prevent Wildfires"...

Followers of Guru Le Guin, The Keshians believe in the rejection of materiality and violence, and understanding the necessity of communion for the maintenance of universal peace. Even if the teachings of Guru Le Guin form the basis of their practices, followers often speak of many others.

The Refulgents are a collection of groups that worship Fire in many forms, seeing it as the most powerful Force of Nature. Refulgents see themselves as stewards, seeking to maintain balance with the world around them by carefully tending to Fire, feeding it that which is necessary so that it may do its work but containing it from spreading wantonly. Fire destroys all in it's path but in doing so gives room for new life to grow strong, this cycle is vital to Refulgents, who see it as the truest law of nature, the old dies so that the new can thrive. They extend this law to themselves in the form of complex rituals, where they build effigies and temples and burn them to symbolically cleanse themselves as the land around them is cleansed.

Fidelii are not a religion in the traditional sense. The remnants of federal, military and state authorities are trying to preserve the small remnants of order that have remained in America. Fighting against the various sects and movements that raised their heads after the event, the constitutionalists seek to restore the old way of life.

column1: #Their localization exists elsewhere already so yee haw

column2: These are the followers of a most unusual Guru, Guru Miller. They believe that Christ is judging all people actively, and has been since before the event, in preparation of his coming. Unlike the Postadventists, whose movement swept through the lands of the far east, these Adventists do not believe that the Event was Christ’s judgement of the world – and denounce the concept as a most vile deception. They also observe the Sabbath of the Jews, instead of that of their fellow Christians, and believe that death is a dreamless sleep, that only the faithful will ever awaken from.

column1: #Their localization exists elsewhere already so yee haw

column2: The Baptists have always held a prominent position in America, and they persisted in their beliefs through the apocalypse. Their defining creed being that one must choose to follow Christ – they cannot simply be born into it. They practice baptism, by immersion, but only for the believer – and can an infant be said to be a believer in anything? The teachings of many Gurus are allowed within their walls, to help every man find their own path to Christ, through their own reading of scripture.

column1: #Their localization exists elsewhere already so yee haw

column2: These Congregationalists reject the Baptist church, and all organized churches, as inherently being infringements on the believer’s ability to find their own path to Christ in the scriptures alone.

In the wake of the event, a Guru lost to time spoke of the need for those who recognized the Charismata of the modern day to band together in their time of crisis, founding a unified church for the faithful. Rebirth, Sanctification, and for many of the lucky faithful, the True Baptism of Fire would evidence a man’s journey towards perfection in God.

Some who profess faith in the modern Charismata rejected the Holy Trinity, held fast to by the vast majority of Christian faithful, as little more than polytheism. They believe that Christ is One, not Three, and that the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit are merely titles, not “persons.” They were rejected by the Charismatic Guru’s new church, and so they have formed their own.
Some who initially followed the Charismatic Guru would stray from their path, rejecting the Charismata and the Baptism of Fire as little more than false sorcery.

Long before the Event sank old America into the state of warfare and infighting that is witnessed today, the Freighters stood guard over the ports of the West Coast, and protected the exotic goods and tools from around the world that allowed the old Americans to live their luxurious, pampered lives. However, even as the lives of untold millions are unsteadied in the current age, nobles and commoners alike still depend on the flow of trade, however fickle, trickling in from across the Pacific to improve their meager livelihoods. Thus, the Freighters stubbornly hold onto their old posts, claiming that they alone possess the knowledge and skills to protect the ocean trade, for they have done so since time immemorial.

Despite the many Great Calamities against these people, it could be said for the First Peoples of Pomo, Patwin, Maidu, Ohlone, Miwok rose above the ashes renewed in their shared veneration of Kuksu whom they believes lives in the far south and healed California so that she may once more provide great bounty to all peoples once again providing new guidance to his children. It is said that other gods sleep in the other cardinal directions waiting for the children of Kuksu to sing their songs and weave their stories in baskets and dances once more.

Despite the many Great Calamities against these people, it could be said for the First Peoples of Pomo, Patwin, Maidu, Ohlone, Miwok rose above the ashes renewed in their shared veneration of Kuksu whom they believes lives in the far south and healed California so that she may once more provide great bounty to all peoples once again providing new guidance to his children. It is said that other gods sleep in the other cardinal directions waiting for the children of Kuksu to sing their songs and weave their stories in baskets and dances once more. The Traditions of the Kuksu people have been codified into a series of sacred stories.

America has always been a melting pot of culture and ideas, nowhere is this more true than Southern California where people from across the sea brought the three great teachings of Confucius, Buddha, and Laozi.  Despite a diverse background, the similarities in doctrine and ethics allowed a harmonious coexistance.  All follow the way of their respective teacher representing a path to enlightenment.  As such, worship of gods and deities is secondary to self-improvement and pursuit of perfection.

America has always been a melting pot of culture and ideas, nowhere is this more true than Southern California. However, as some new concepts were introduced, so too is the reinterpretation and repurposing of these ideas. However this movements arise is beyond our understanding. They are a spiritual group that excessively Yoga and collecting their Chi. Okay?

As The Event rippled throughout the Land, a new spiritual movement gain traction as the way to "liberate" all people from the "suffering". Nirodhist movement identify the world as Samsara, a machination of a greater being, where everyone live in a circle of constant rebirth. Their villification of the world, and nihilistic practices drew harsh criticism from other followers of Buddha.

Coming from the land of the Punjab in the distant land of Bharata, the Sikh religion sees itself as the universal religion that teaches the ultimate truth of god and unifies all believers, freeing them from falsehood.  The Sikhs follow a succession of 10 Gurus, with the line ending at the living guru in the form of the Guru Granth Sahib. Sikhs uphold a rigid code of conduct which includes wearing symbolic articles called the "five K's" and following the four prohibitions which make one into a Khalsa, a true member of the Sikh community.  By stressing universality and outreach, the Sikhs brought many into their fold noting the same, one god was worshiped by all from Bharata.

The Mainline church is the union of several ancient churches, whose sisterhood dates to the founding of America itself. Many creeds and Gurus coexist within this church, following Gurus as diverse as Luther, Calvin, and Wesley. The binding doctrines holding these churches together is the need for the church to uplift all men, eliminating the evils of the world and bring everyone to the teachings of Christ, and for all men to be personally involved in their church.

Followers of Guru Calvin. Believing that cooperating with false Gurus is a fraudulent virtue, and that the Mainline church has fallen into the heresy of Modernism, the post-Event Puritans reject ecumenism and have set up their own Presbyteries.

Followers of Guru Luther. Rejecting ritualism, and the need to focus outwards, Pietists instead focus internally, on those already faithful and on their own circumstances, spiritual and physical, instead of those outside the faith.

The Armenian Apostolic Faith is one of the oldest faiths in Christendom, founded by the Apostles Bartholomew and Thaddeus. They are miaphysite believing Christ to have one nature where both the divine and human are united. After the event the Armenian Apostolic Community of California found itself separated from the Mother Church. In an attempt to stay united a church council was held in the Cathedral of Saint Leon and the Catholicosate of Los Angeles was established.

After the Council of Cathedral of Saint Leon was held some Armenian Apostolics refused to acknowledge its decision, proclaiming the reigning Catholicos unworthy of leading the faithful. The Armenian Paraktelics see their faith as the true conintuation of the church founded by the Apostles Bartholomew and Thaddeus. All those outside the church are hetanosner and are not to be asscociated with.

The Cosmists revere the divine spirit of the Universe. They see "Mother Earth" as but a small fragment of humanity's true benefactor. The vast expanse surrounding humanity all plays a role in giving Earth light, heat, minerals, energy, direction, inspiration, and imagination. The Physicists -- those who could truly understand and appreciate its vastness, and learn the secrets hidden within -- were great men who lived before the Event. They are gone now, only their words remain.

After the event, those who sought to maintain the structures of the old provincial government became know as the Legislators. They maintain some semblance of democratic processes in Victoria out of their old seat of government, The Ledge. Despite their relative stability and dominance on the islands, they have had troubles bringing the many fractured realms and peoples of old Bee-Sea back into the fold. Legislators believe that only through the authority and mandate derived from The Crown can they find stability and prosperity. Legislative realms focus many of their resources on their fleets and navies, seeing the Salish Sea as the lifeblood of their civilization. They tend to be very decentralized in their way of life
column3: leaving individual communities largely to govern themselves, and valuing the diversity within their lands.

column2: The Theosophists are the followers of the Guru Krishnamurti, a renowned sage who was said to be the last in a long line of Masters that shepherded the spiritual and intellectual development of humanity. According to their teachings, it was when the world closed their hearts to the lessons of Krishnamurti that mankind grew distant from Nature and Truth, relying more and more upon the various systems that they used to build the Old World, before collapsing under the burden of ignorance and desire that it carried upon its back. Numerous legends even hold that Krishnamurti himself was alive to witness the Event, spending his final years guiding the Theosophists through those dark days of turmoil and uncertainty. The Theosophists de emphasize the importance of organized religion, scripture, ritual, and hierarchy as a source of direct enlightenment, viewing them simply as roads for every individual to access the source of Truth.

Navigants believe those who are brave, those who are patient, are blessed by the sea. Legends warn of the dangers and curses of the sea, but also speak of miracles and blessings from he who multiplies the fish. Our Savior and provider, call us to walk over the waters with you. And give us Our Daily Fish, Amen.

Proclaiming being the true lords of Mexico the days before the event, Contrabandistas cling to hubs of power and isolated fortresses. They believe laws and morals were suggestions, their honor and pride shapes them, and they are exempt if some good is done. They’re a brutal caste of tyrants, idolizing feats of bravery as sung in Los Corridos. But the Event robbed their trade routes and their clients, and now their power wanes. Are they really the lords of the land?

As Jesus and the Apostles healed by faith, those gifted can work wonders through prayer and  intercession from El Niño Fidencio and San Chárbel. A wide range of beliefs, but united by miracles and signs.

Among the Yaqui, the heirs of the Sun, an ancient tradition met the Gospel. Believing that at the end of the world those who were baptized were the only to be saved and inherit the world. These chosen are the proud Yaqui, free from the colonists yet armed with their catholic traditions.
